intro: Navarretia cotulifolia var. bowmaniae, commonly known as the Bowman's navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Navarretia cotulifolia var. bowmaniae is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to mild, Mediterranean climates.
